Maybe Colin (the author of SharpNEAT) can explain this...I'm not 
sure about the inner workings of SharpNEAT.

ken

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "Chris Turner" <chris@l...> wrote:
> --- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "logical_creations" <chris@l...> 
wrote:
> > For each call to the Evaluate method there are 10 calls to the 
> > SequenceTest method but even though the SequenceTest method 
resets 
> > the input signals to new values the resulting output signal is 
> > always the same for all 10 calls.  This explains why I'm getting 
89 
> > as a best fitness but I don't understand why the output signal 
is 
> > not different for each of the 10 calls to SequenceTest.  The 
> > XorEvaluator has more than one pass through the network with 
> > different parameters and doesn't suffer from the same problem.
> > 
> > Can any of you more experienced NEAT users see what I am doing 
wrong 
> > here?
> 
> I managed to solve the problem.  I made the assumption that as the 
> output signal is between 0 and 1, that the input signals should 
also 
> be beween 0 and 1.  This is why I divided the number by 10 when 
> setting the value.
> 
> After removing the divide by 10, the network learned to reach 100 
> fitness which is what I wanted to achieve.  The only thing still 
> puzzling me is that I'm not sure that I understand why there is a 
> different between dividing the input signal by 10 and not dividing.
> 
> Regards
> 
> Chris Turner
